required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Efficacy and Safety of Wishbone HA as Bone Graft Substitute, a Pre-market Clinical Investigation
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Single Center, Pivotal Investigation to Investigate Efficacy and Safety of WISHBONE HA, Used as Bone Graft Substitute for Different Indications Where Bone Grafting Procedures Are Required Before Implant Placement.

brief_summary.textblock:
Evaluation of efficacy and safety of Wishbone HA as bone graft substitute, a pre-market clinical investigation.
Group1: Extraction Socket management Group 2: Sinus lift

primary_outcome.measure: Measure of the bone augmentation success
primary_outcome.description: Group 1 - Extraction Socket Management: Efficacy endpoint based on the bone augmentation success (bone gain after bone augmentation procedure) measured by Cone Beam CT

primary_outcome.measure: Measure of the bone augmentation success
primary_outcome.description: Group 2 - Sinus lift: Efficacy endpoint based on the bone augmentation success (bone gain after bone augmentation procedure) measured by Cone Beam CT

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety endpoint: Collection of all device related adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: Group 1 - Extraction Socket Management: Collection of all device related adverse events reported by the investigator and by the patient from the time of procedure up to the time of implant insertion: Abnormal tissue reaction of the surrounding area, Not expected complications, Loss of material, Additional signs of Inflammation, Wound dehiscence, Membrane exposure, Persistent feeling of discomfort at the gingival incision

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety endpoint: Collection of all device related adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: Group 2 - Sinus lift: Collection of all device related adverse events reported by the investigator and by the patient from the time of procedure up to the time of implant insertion: Abnormal tissue reaction of the surrounding area, Not expected complications, Loss of material, Additional signs of Inflammation, Wound dehiscence, Membrane exposure, Persistent feeling of discomfort at the gingival incision

secondary_outcome.measure: Procedure success: ability to successfully perform the implants placement
secondary_outcome.description: Group 1 - Extraction Socket Management: The procedure is a success if the bone is sufficient for implant placement and implant can be placed successfully with sufficient good primary stability (>10Ncm) measured using a torque wrench.

secondary_outcome.measure: Procedure success: ability to successfully perform the implants placement
secondary_outcome.description: Group 2 - Sinus lift: The procedure is a success if the bone is sufficient for implant placement and implant can be placed successfully with sufficient good primary stability (>10Ncm) measured using a torque wrench.

secondary_outcome.measure: Site preparation: need for under or over preparation of the osteotomy
secondary_outcome.description: Group 1 - Extraction Socket Management: If the second CBCT shows favourable results, implant placement will be performed. Depending on the clinician's choice, a CAD-CAM surgical guide could be prepared to facilitate proper positioning of the implant(s). Access to the bone crest will be made with an as minimally-invasive surgical approach as possible, depending on the surgeon's choice. The drilling procedure will be performed according to the manufacturer's instructions for the placement the implant(s); during this drilling procedure, the clinician will determine if the bone quality is sufficient for placing the implant(s).

secondary_outcome.measure: Site preparation: need for under or over preparation of the osteotomy
secondary_outcome.description: Group 2 - Sinus lift: If the second CBCT shows favourable results, implant placement will be performed. Depending on the clinician's choice, a CAD-CAM surgical guide could be prepared to facilitate proper positioning of the implant(s). Access to the bone crest will be made with an as minimally-invasive surgical approach as possible, depending on the surgeon's choice. The drilling procedure will be performed according to the manufacturer's instructions for the placement the implant(s); during this drilling procedure, the clinician will determine if the bone quality is sufficient for placing the implant(s).

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the bone quality and bone quantity
secondary_outcome.description: Group 1 - Extraction Socket Management: Bone quality and bone quantity will be assessed following Lekholm and Zarb classification.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the bone quality and bone quantity
secondary_outcome.description: Group 2 - Sinus lift: Bone quality and bone quantity will be assessed following Lekholm and Zarb classification.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after after definitive prosthesis delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Implant survival will be assessed by answering if: The implant remains in the jaw The implant is damaged to the extent that it cannot be restored

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after after definitive prosthesis delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Implant Success will be defined in accordance with the criteria proposed by van Steenberghe. Answering yes or no to the following statements: The implant causes allergic, toxic or gross infectious reactions either locally or systemically. The implant offers anchorage to a functional prosthesis. The implant shows signs of fracture or bending. The implant shows signs of peri-implant radiolucency on an intra-oral radiograph using a paralleling technique strictly perpendicular to the implant-bone interface. The implant shows mobility when individually tested by tapping or rocking with a hand instrument.
The soft tissue contour adjacent to the implant is assessed from definitive prosthetic placement to the 1-year follow up visit using the papilla index according to Jemt 1997

The plaque accumulation is assessed using the modified Plaque Index (mPlI) according to Mombelli et.al: 0 = No detectible plaque 1 = Plaque only recognized by running a probe across the marginal surface of the implant 2 = Plaque can be seen by the naked eye 3 = Abundance of soft matter

The bleeding tendency is assessed by a modified Sulcus Bleeding Index (mBI) according to Mombelli et. al: 0 = No bleeding when a periodontal probe is passed along the gingival margin adjacent to the implant = Isolated bleeding spots visible = Blood forms a confluent red line on the margin 3 = Heavy or profuse bleeding

Classification will be performed as: 0 = No keratinized mucosa around the implant. 1= Keratinized mucosa Measurement in mm of the keratinized mucosa in the apico-coronal direction using a periodontal probe

The quality of life will be assessed at all visits by a questionnaire which is going to be completed be the subject. The shortened version from Brennan et al., OHIP-14 has been adopted for use in this investigation

intervention.description: Evaluation of a device made of deproteinized bovine bone material as bone graft substitute in different indications requiring bone grafting procedures before implant placement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject signed the informed consent form
- Subject is ≥18 and ≤ 80 years old.
- Subject presented in need of:
1. tooth extraction without estimated need of connective tissue grafting OR
2. defect in the upper jaw requiring sinus lift with or without lateral augmentation procedure prior to implant placement
- The subject is willing and able to comply with all investigation related procedures (such as exercising oral hygiene and attending all follow-up visits).
- Full-mouth bleeding score (FMBS) lower than 25%
- Full-mouth plaque score (FMPI) lower than 25%
- The subject displays no clinical contraindications for a 2-stage surgical procedure
Exclusion Criteria:
- Less than 2 mm of remaining keratinized mucosa
- Severe vertical resorption of the crest (except internal resorptions, i.e. expanded sinuses)
- Ridge with prior bone augmentation procedure performed (i.e ridge preservation)
- Any disorders in the planned implant area such as previous tumors, chronic bone disease.
- Alcohol or drug abuse as noted in subject records or in subject history.
- Any ongoing application of interfering medication (steroid therapy, bisphosphonate, etc).
- Reason to believe that the treatment might have a negative effect on the subject's overall situation (psychiatric problems), as noted in subject records or history.
- Smoking: >10 cigarettes per day
